import Mathlib
import Aesop

set_option maxHeartbeats 0
open BigOperators Real Nat Topology Rat Filter
theorem theorem_8_3_3 {Î± Î² : Type*} [TopologicalSpace Î±] [TopologicalSpace Î²] (f : Î± â†’ Î²) (u_hat : Î±) (v_hat : Î²) :
  (Filter.Tendsto f (nhds u_hat) (nhds v_hat)) â†”
  (âˆ€ (u_seq : â„• â†’ Î±),
    (âˆ€ n, u_seq n âˆˆ {x | f x âˆˆ Set.univ}) â†’ -- This represents that u_seq n is in the domain of f, denoted D_f.
    (Filter.Tendsto u_seq Filter.atTop (nhds u_hat)) â†’
    (Filter.Tendsto (f âˆ˜ u_seq) Filter.atTop (nhds v_hat))) := by sorry

proof_steps.natural_language:
We assume:
â€¢ $\lim_{u\to \widehat u}f(u)=\widehat v$ [def_1].
Therefore, we conclude:
â€¢ For any $\epsilon > 0$, there exists a $\delta > 0$ such that for any $u \in D_f$, if $\rho(u, \widehat{u}) < \delta$, then $\sigma(f(u), \widehat{v}) < \epsilon$ [l1].
proof_steps.lean_tactics:
intro h_tendsto_f
  rw [Filter.tendsto_def] at h_tendsto_f
  intros Îµ hÎµ
  rcases h_tendsto_f (nhds v_hat) (IsOpen.mem_nhds (isOpen_ball' v_hat Îµ) (mem_ball_self hÎµ)) with âŸ¨S, hS_nhds, hS_subsetâŸ©
  rcases (nhds_basis_metric_sphere u_hat).mem_iff.mp hS_nhds with âŸ¨Î´, hÎ´, hS_subset_ballâŸ©
  use Î´
  constructor
  exact hÎ´
  intros u h_u_in_domain hu_lt_delta
  exact hS_subset <| hS_subset_ball hu_lt_delta

  (Filter.Tendsto f (nhds u_hat) (nhds v_hat)) â†”
  (âˆ€ (u_seq : â„• â†’ Î±),
    (âˆ€ n, u_seq n âˆˆ {x | f x âˆˆ Set.univ}) â†’ -- This represents that u_seq n is in the domain of f, denoted D_f.
    (Filter.Tendsto u_seq Filter.atTop (nhds u_hat)) â†’
    (Filter.Tendsto (f âˆ˜ u_seq) Filter.atTop (nhds v_hat))) := by
  intro h_tendsto_f

  intros Îµ hÎµ
  rcases h_tendsto_f (nhds v_hat) (IsOpen.mem_nhds (isOpen_ball' v_hat Îµ) (mem_ball_self hÎµ)) with âŸ¨S, hS_nhds, hS_subsetâŸ©
